main.name: Haramrit Singh Khurana
main.occupation: Graduate Student at George Mason University
main.description: I recently interned as a Software Engineer Intern at a local healthcare startup this summer, and am currently looking for full-time opportunities in software engineering.
main.bio: I am a tech professional with expertise in Java, Python, app development and Agile methodology gained in my pursuit of an M.S. in Computer Science. I am passionate about creating quality software chunks that help make this world a better place. Along with possessing effective problem-solving skills I am also an excellent communicator with strong analytical and organizational skills.
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email or by using the form below if you'd like to get in contact with me.

resume.skillmessage: I'm a dilettante and am always interested in playing around with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: • Used C#, object-oriented (OO) design patterns, relational DBs, and data modeling techniques to update existing model schemas • Gathering and analyzing business and functional requirements and translating business requirements into technical design specifications. • Worked on implementing the “image upload” and “comment like” feature by developing appropriate web components using ASP.NET Core framework and Blazor and managed version control and DevOps with Git and Azure  • Worked with the Play Services Publishing team to publish the app on Play Store

work.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
work.description: • Working as a Graduate Teaching Assistant and Lab Instructor for the course Applied IT Programming (IT 207) at GMU, instructing and grading the students on HTML, CSS, PHP and MySQL coursework. Resolve any student queries throughout the course. • Assisting two faculty instructors by teaching a batch of 60 students in recitation, laboratory, and discussion sessions, helping software users in a Computer laboratory.

work.title: Full Stack Developer Intern
work.description: • Remodeled the website Don Bosco Journal of Science and Engineering - a portal for the submission and review of academic papers • Lead a team of six developers to write reusable, testable and efficient code using Node.js & Mongoose • Introduced a tag-based paper-reviewer matching algorithm to automate the review assignment process • Achieved a 3x speedup over its previous iteration.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have mostly used Git for version control in small teams.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Java was my second programming language that I started using (after C) in college a couple years ago. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: ReactJS
skills.description: I am fairly new to React and found it a bit confusing at first. However, I realized how powerful and easy to use it is, once I got the hang of it. This website is also made using React.

skills.name: AWS
skills.description: For this, I just have one word - AMAZING! I used some of the services to host a couple course projects, but after that, I wanted to learn more. And hence I got certified as an AWS Solutions Architect - Associate.

skills.name: Meteor JS
skills.description: I enjoy MeteorJS for it's ease of configuration and its ability to get a full stack prototype up and running quickly. I used MeteorJS in a team for a Startup Programming class in UVIC in conjunction with React to build the MVP for Smirkspace (below in portfolio)

skills.name: Node.js
skills.description: I developed my first application with Node.js back in 2016, and have never looked back since. It has become my server-side scripting language of choice. The bulk of my experience with it has been in conjunction with using MongoDB as the supporting database.

skills.name: Bootstrap 4
skills.description: I was introduced to Bootstrap during a web dev workshop I attended in late 2015, and honestly I was blown away with what you could do with a simple CSS framework. Since then, I have used Bootstrap more often than not when designing the layout for my sites.

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: I have used many different database systems and am better educated and experienced with Relational Databases. However, for many applications, especially Node.js applications that I have worked on, I found MongoDB to be a better alternative for those use cases.

projects.title: NumPy for C
projects.category: Open source project focused on augmenting the C library

projects.category: Capstone project, won 1st runner up in annual project competition

projects.title: SpaceTerra

projects.title: DBJSE
projects.category: Research paper review portal, Tech stack: Node.js, Express and MongoDB

testimonials.text:
It’s rare that you come across standout talent like Haramrit. 

 I had the pleasure of working with Haramrit for 6 months at the Nexus 8 International, collaborating on several projects. 

 I was particularly impressed by Haramrit's ability to quickly learn a new technology and handle even the toughest issues—effortlessly. That skill often takes years to develop professionals, but it seemed to come perfectly naturally to him. 

Haramrit would be an asset to any team.

That Haramrit Singh Khurana must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is surprising that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have hardly any job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
